content.description: Figure 1. Regulation of hormones secreted by the thyroid gland. The <math alttext="plus sign" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo></math> indicates stimulation and the <math alttext="minus sign" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo></math> indicates inhibition.
content.question: Based on Figure 1, which of the following most likely occurs in response to an increase in the secretion of thyroid hormones <math alttext="T 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>T3</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="T 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>T4</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The hypothalamus secretes more <math alttext="T R H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>TRH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to maintain the increase in thyroid hormone secretion.

The pituitary gland decreases secretion of <math alttext="T S H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>TSH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, which results in an increase in <math alttext="T R H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>TRH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> secretion.

The thyroid hormones directly inhibit the hypothalamus, which results in a decrease in <math alttext="T R H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>TRH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> secretion.

The thyroid gland increases secretion of <math alttext="T 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>T4</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in order to cause a decrease in <math alttext="T 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>T3</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> secretion.

content.answer: The thyroid hormones directly inhibit the hypothalamus, which results in a decrease in <math alttext="T R H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>TRH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> secretion.
